That's great to hear that the class structure and recipes were well-organized and easy to follow! It's always important to have a good instructor who can break down complex recipes into manageable steps, and it sounds like Chef Maria did a great job of that.

The Cooking Academy is a great option for a sushi-making class! I've heard excellent reviews about their classes, and sushi-making is a fantastic skill to learn. It's a very hands-on and interactive class, where you'll get to learn the art of making sushi rice, preparing various types of fish and fillings, and assembling your own sushi rolls.

The Cooking Academy is known for their small class sizes, which allows for personalized attention and guidance from the instructors. They also provide a fun and relaxed atmosphere, which makes the learning experience even more enjoyable.

If you're interested in taking the sushi-making class, I'd definitely recommend signing up for it! You'll get to learn a new skill, enjoy a fun and interactive cooking experience, and take home some delicious sushi to share with friends and family.

Have you ever made sushi before, or is this a new culinary adventure for you?
